arm_group.description: obese women who are volunteers for the 3 months exercise programs

brief_summary.textblock:
Glypican4, CTRP3, CTRP5 are emerging novel adipokines mediating obesity and inflammation
      related disorders. RBP4 and adiponectin are well known important adipokines. Therefore, we
      examine the circulating levels of theses adipokines in the subjects with or without
      metabolic syndrome. Furthermore, we tried to clarify the effect of exercise on the
      circulating these adipokines.

clinical_study.brief_title: Glypican4 and CTRP5 in Metabolic Syndrome and the Effect of Exercise on These Adipokines

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  Women  between  30  and  60 years  of  age  who  had  a  body  mass index (BMI) more
             than 25 kg/m2

          -  The subjects of metabolic syndrome and age, gender matched non metabolic syndrome
             among the participants of  Korean SO Study (KSOS) study, which is an ongoing
             epidemiologic study supported by the Korea Science and Engineering Foundation

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  participants  had  a  history  of  cardiovascular  disease

          -  any type of diabetes

          -  stage 2 hypertension

          -  malignant disease,  severe  renal,  or  hepatic  disease

          -  Subjects  taking medications that might affect body weight or body composition

intervention.description: training session consisting of a brief warm-up, followed by an approximately 45-min session of aerobic exercise at an intensity of 60-75% of the age-predicted maximum heart rate (approximately 300 kcal/day) and a 20-min muscle strength train- ing programme (approximately 100 kcal/day), followed by a brief cool-down period.

clinical_study.official_title: Effects of Exercise on Glypican4,CTRP3,5 and RBP4 Levels and Circulating Levels of These Adipokines in the Subjects With or Without Metabolic Syndrome

primary_outcome.measure: The changes of circulating glypican4 levels after 3 months exercise
The changes of circulating CTRP3 levels after 3 months exercise
The changes of circulating CTRP5 levels after 3 months exercise
The changes of circulating RBP4 levels after 3 months exercise
The changes of circulating adiponectin levels after 3 months exercise

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

secondary_outcome.measure: Circulating glypican4 levels in the subjects with or without metabolic syndrome
Circulating CTRP3 levels in the subjects with or without metabolic syndrome
Circulating CTRP5 levels in the subjects with or without metabolic syndrome
Circulating RBP4 levels in the subjects with or without metabolic syndrome
Circulating adiponectin levels in the subjects with or without metabolic syndrome

clinical_study.study_design: Intervention Model: Single Group Assignment, Masking: Open Label
